intro: Monarda pectinata, commonly known as the showy tickseed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with orange centers. The plant typically grows to a height of 2 to 4 feet and features narrow, gray-green leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Monarda pectinata is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
